We had a real opportunity to help these student borrowers reduce their debt and get their lives back on track — an outcome that would have been great for them and this nation.

Instead, too many borrowers are saddled with unaffordable debts.

How will this decision impact their lives?

The majority of these debts are held by families who have zero net worth.

These borrowers did what they were told is right. They attended college, took out loans, and hoped that their hard work would pay off.

Working families are buried in so much student debt that they can’t afford to buy a home, start a business, save for emergencies, or fully participate in the economy.

Nearly 90% of the relief dollars in the President’s plan would go to borrowers earning less than $75,000 a year.

Today’s ruling by the Supreme Court hurts the tens of millions of Americans who are plagued by student loan debt in pursuit of a quality education, particularly low-and middle-income borrowers and communities of color.

Mark my words: I will do everything I can to ensure that the freedom to exist unapologetically prevails.
